description: Visualize OpenTelemetry (OTEL) collector metrics (tested with OTEL contrib v0.120.1)

options.content:
This dashboard uses the metrics generated by the OpenTelemetry Collector. It is used to understand the overall performance and health of the OpenTelemetry Collector.
Chart panels may require 5 minutes after the Demo is started before rendering data.

panels.description:
Accepted: count/rate of spans successfully pushed into the pipeline.
Refused: count/rate of spans that could not be pushed into the pipeline.
panels.title: Spans ${metric:text}

panels.description:
Accepted: count/rate of metric points successfully pushed into the pipeline.
Refused: count/rate of metric points that could not be pushed into the pipeline.
panels.title: Metric Points ${metric:text}

panels.description:
Accepted: count/rate of log records successfully pushed into the pipeline.
Refused: count/rate of log records that could not be pushed into the pipeline.
panels.title: Log Records ${metric:text}

panels.description:
Accepted: count/rate of spans successfully pushed into the next component in the pipeline.
Refused: count/rate of spans that were rejected by the next component in the pipeline.
Dropped: count/rate of spans that were dropped
panels.title: Accepted Spans ${metric:text}

panels.description:
Accepted: count/rate of metric points successfully pushed into the next component in the pipeline.
Refused: count/rate of metric points that were rejected by the next component in the pipeline.
Dropped: count/rate of metric points that were dropped
panels.title: Accepted Metric Points ${metric:text}

panels.description:
Accepted: count/rate of log records successfully pushed into the next component in the pipeline.
Refused: count/rate of log records that were rejected by the next component in the pipeline.
Dropped: count/rate of log records that were dropped
panels.title: Accepted Log Records ${metric:text}

panels.description: Number of units in the batch
panels.title: Batch Send Size Heatmap

panels.description: Number of times the batch was sent due to a size trigger. Number of times the batch was sent due to a timeout trigger.

targets.legendFormat: Batch sent due to a size trigger: {{processor}}
Batch sent due to a timeout trigger: {{processor}} {{service_instance_id}}

panels.title: Batch Metrics 2

panels.description:
Sent: count/rate of spans successfully sent to destination.
Enqueue: count/rate of spans failed to be added to the sending queue.
Failed: count/rate of spans in failed attempts to send to destination.
panels.title: Spans ${metric:text}

panels.description:
Sent: count/rate of metric points successfully sent to destination.
Enqueue: count/rate of metric points failed to be added to the sending queue.
Failed: count/rate of metric points in failed attempts to send to destination.
panels.title: Metric Points ${metric:text}

panels.description:
Sent: count/rate of log records successfully sent to destination.
Enqueue: count/rate of log records failed to be added to the sending queue.
Failed: count/rate of log records in failed attempts to send to destination.
panels.title: Log Records ${metric:text}

panels.description: Current size of the retry queue (in batches)
panels.title: Exporter Queue Size

panels.description: Fixed capacity of the retry queue (in batches)
panels.title: Exporter Queue Capacity

panels.description: Total physical memory (resident set size)
panels.title: Total RSS Memory

panels.description: Total bytes of memory obtained from the OS (see 'go doc runtime.MemStats.Sys')
panels.title: Total Runtime Sys Memory

panels.description: Bytes of allocated heap objects (see 'go doc runtime.MemStats.HeapAlloc')
panels.title: Total Runtime Heap Memory

panels.description: Total CPU user and system time in percentage
panels.title: CPU Usage

panels.description: Number of service instances, which are reporting metrics
panels.title: Service Instance Count

targets.expr:
max(otelcol_process_uptime${suffix_seconds}${suffix_total}{service_instance_id=~".*",job="$job",service_version=".+"}) by (service_instance_id,service_name,service_version)
or
max(
  otelcol_process_uptime${suffix_seconds}${suffix_total}{service_instance_id=~".*",job="$job"} 
  * on(job, instance) 
  group_left(service_version) 
  (
    target_info 
    * on(job, instance) 
    group_left 
    label_replace(target_info{}, "service_instance_id", "$1", "instance", "(.*)")
  )
) by (service_instance_id, service_name, service_version)

panels.description: Receivers -> Processor(s) -> Exporters (Node Graph panel is beta, so this panel may not show data correctly).

targets.expr:
# receivers
label_replace(
  label_join(
    label_join(
      sum(${metric:value}(
        otelcol_receiver_accepted_spans${suffix_total}{job="$job"}[$__rate_interval])
      ) by (receiver)
      , "id", "-rcv-", "transport", "receiver"
    )
    , "title", "", "transport", "receiver"
  )
  , "icon", "arrow-to-right", "", ""
)

# dummy processor
or
label_replace(
  label_replace(
    label_replace(
      (sum(rate(otelcol_process_uptime${suffix_seconds}${suffix_total}{job="$job"}[$__rate_interval])))
      , "id", "processor", "", ""
    )
    , "title", "Processor(s)", "", ""
  )
  , "icon", "arrow-random", "", ""
)

# exporters
or
label_replace(
  label_join(
    label_join(
      sum(${metric:value}(
        otelcol_exporter_sent_spans${suffix_total}{job="$job"}[$__rate_interval])
      ) by (exporter)
      , "id", "-exp-", "transport", "exporter"
    )
    , "title", "", "transport", "exporter"
  )
  , "icon", "arrow-from-right", "", ""
)

# receivers -> processor
label_join(
    label_replace(
        label_join(
            (sum(rate(otelcol_receiver_accepted_spans${suffix_total}{job="$job"}[$__rate_interval])) by (receiver))
            ,"source", "-rcv-", "transport", "receiver"
        )
        ,"target", "processor", "", ""
    )
    , "id", "-", "source", "target"
)

# processor -> exporters
or
label_join(
    label_replace(
        label_join(
            (sum(rate(otelcol_exporter_sent_spans${suffix_total}{job="$job"}[$__rate_interval])) by (exporter))
            , "target", "-exp-", "transport", "exporter"
        )
        , "source", "processor", "", ""
    )
    , "id", "-", "source", "target"
)

panels.title: Spans Flow

panels.description: Receivers -> Processor(s) -> Exporters (Node Graph panel is beta, so this panel may not show data correctly).

targets.expr:
# receivers
label_replace(
  label_join(
    label_join(
      (sum(
        ${metric:value}(otelcol_receiver_accepted_metric_points${suffix_total}{job="$job"}[$__rate_interval])
      ) by (receiver))
      , "id", "-rcv-", "transport", "receiver"
    )
    , "title", "", "transport", "receiver"
  )
  , "icon", "arrow-to-right", "", ""
)

# dummy processor
or
label_replace(
  label_replace(
    label_replace(
      (sum(rate(otelcol_process_uptime${suffix_seconds}${suffix_total}{job="$job"}[$__rate_interval])))
      , "id", "processor", "", ""
    )
    , "title", "Processor(s)", "", ""
  )
  , "icon", "arrow-random", "", ""
)

# exporters
or
label_replace(
  label_join(
    label_join(
      (sum(
        ${metric:value}(otelcol_exporter_sent_metric_points${suffix_total}{job="$job"}[$__rate_interval])
      ) by (exporter))
      , "id", "-exp-", "transport", "exporter"
    )
    , "title", "", "transport", "exporter"
  )
  , "icon", "arrow-from-right", "", ""
)

# receivers -> processor
label_join(
    label_replace(
        label_join(
            (sum(rate(otelcol_receiver_accepted_metric_points${suffix_total}{job="$job"}[$__rate_interval])) by (receiver))
            , "source", "-rcv-", "transport", "receiver"
        )
        , "target", "processor", "", ""
    )
    , "id", "-", "source", "target"
)

# processor -> exporters
or 
label_join(
    label_replace(
        label_join(
            (sum(rate(otelcol_exporter_sent_metric_points${suffix_total}{job="$job"}[$__rate_interval])) by (exporter))
            , "target", "-exp-", "transport", "exporter"
        )
        , "source", "processor", "", ""
    )
    , "id", "-", "source", "target"
)

panels.title: Metric Points Flow

panels.description: Receivers -> Processor(s) -> Exporters (Node Graph panel is beta, so this panel may not show data correctly).

targets.expr:
# receivers
label_replace(
  label_join(
    label_join(
      sum(${metric:value}(
        otelcol_receiver_accepted_log_records${suffix_total}{job="$job"}[$__rate_interval])
      ) by (receiver)
      , "id", "-rcv-", "transport", "receiver"
    )
    , "title", "", "transport", "receiver"
  )
  , "icon", "arrow-to-right", "", ""
)

# dummy processor
or
label_replace(
  label_replace(
    label_replace(
      (sum(rate(otelcol_process_uptime${suffix_seconds}${suffix_total}{job="$job"}[$__rate_interval])))
      , "id", "processor", "", ""
    )
    , "title", "Processor(s)", "", ""
  )
  , "icon", "arrow-random", "", ""
)

# exporters
or
label_replace(
  label_join(
    label_join(
      sum(${metric:value}(
        otelcol_exporter_sent_log_records${suffix_total}{job="$job"}[$__rate_interval])
      ) by (exporter)
      , "id", "-exp-", "transport", "exporter"
    )
    , "title", "", "transport", "exporter"
  )
  , "icon", "arrow-from-right", "", ""
)

# receivers -> processor
label_join(
    label_replace(
        label_join(
            (sum(rate(otelcol_receiver_accepted_log_records${suffix_total}{job="$job"}[$__rate_interval])) by (receiver))
            , "source", "-rcv-", "transport", "receiver"
        )
        , "target", "processor", "", ""
    )
    , "id", "-edg-", "source", "target"
)

# processor -> exporters
or 
label_join(
    label_replace(
        label_join(
            (sum(rate(otelcol_exporter_sent_log_records${suffix_total}{job="$job"}[$__rate_interval])) by (exporter))
            ,"target","-exp-","transport","exporter"
        )
        ,"source","processor","",""
    )
    ,"id","-edg-","source","target"
)

panels.title: Log Records Flow

panels.description: Measures the number of messages received per RPC. Should be 1 for all non-streaming RPCs. GRPC status codes: https://grpc.github.io/grpc/core/md_doc_statuscodes.html
panels.title: RPC server responses by GRPC status code (receivers)

panels.description: Measures the number of messages received per RPC. Should be 1 for all non-streaming RPCs. GRPC status codes: https://grpc.github.io/grpc/core/md_doc_statuscodes.html
panels.title: RPC client responses by GRPC status code (exporters)

panels.description:
Added: Number of namespace add events received.
Updated: Number of namespace update events received.
panels.title: Namespaces

panels.description:
Added: Number of pod add events received.
Updated: Number of pod update events received.
Deleted: Number of pod delete events received.
panels.title: Pods

list.description: Detailed metrics must be configured in the collector configuration. They add grouping by transport protocol (http/grpc) for receivers.
list.label: Additional groupping
list.name: grouping
list.query: None (basic metrics) :  , By transport (detailed metrics) : \,transport, By service instance id : \,service_instance_id

list.description: Some exporter(s) configuration(s) may add the metric suffix _total. This variable will detect this case.
list.label: Suffix _total
list.name: suffix_total

list.description: Some exporter(s) configuration(s) may add the metric suffix _seconds_total. This variable will detect this "_seconds" suffix part.
list.label: Suffix _seconds
list.name: suffix_seconds

list.description: Some exporter(s) configuration(s) may add the metric suffix _bytes. This variable will detect this "_bytes" suffix part.
list.label: Suffix _bytes
list.name: suffix_bytes

list.description: Some metrics (e.g., RPC, HTTP) may no longer have the otelcol_ prefix. This will detect it. See https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-collector/pull/9759
list.label: Prefix
list.name: prefix

title: OpenTelemetry Collector
